sentences.text: hi, Talha.
How are you?
Hello.
Can you hear me?
Hello.
How are you?
Hi, I'm good.
Thank you.
How are you?
Good.
Thank you.
Great.
Let me know when we can get started.
I think your colleagues are joining in as well.
Perfect.
Thank you.
Hi.
Hey, I think we're all here now.
Okay.
So you guys have joined together?
Perfect.
No worries.
Let's get started.
Let me just quickly introduce myself for everyone.

My name is Yukta and I'm the senior account executive here at hiver as well as your point of contact, I'll be the one taking you through this evaluation and helping you going forward, understanding you have already started off with the trial that you have set up with your, hello at the rate, email address, have added four individuals as well.

I would just want to touch base on that, understand a bit more in terms of what exactly you're trying to achieve so that I can make sure that we are covering all those points and if required, I can help you with the trial setup as well.
Yeah.
So we want to use hello as a shared inbox and just a very basic ticketing system as well.
Understood.
And it is going to be managed by these four people who are already there as part of the inbox.
Yeah.
There'll be three users.
There will be three users.
I currently see four there's one as Dawn at the rate.
Yeah, Dawn, Katisha, and Katie.
Dawn, Katisha, and Katie, you'll not be part of it, Talha.
No.
I'm just an administrator.
For now.
Okay.
I won't be using it.
I'll just be setting it up.
But you would be part of hiver, right?
Yes.
Then we'll have to count you as a user as well.
So in total, then we'll have four users to be part of it.
Okay.
Yeah, perfect.
Great.
So, could you talk to me about how you were doing things up till now?
What things are important to you to change in the workflow that you're managing today, so that I can help you whether hiver checks all those boxes and how you could use it to the best?
So, this is a new workflow we've recently set up Google workspace and moved from a shared Gmail account to our own domain.
Okay?
So we're looking at hiring more people and trying to understand how we can manage a shared inbox.
We don't want to go with a full blown CRM system just yet.
Yeah, absolutely.
Since this is the first time that you're also using it and you're now on Google workspace.
I think you could start it off between these individuals, see how it works and how you're able to manage the shared email addresses.
And of course, if it goes well, you can extend it to other teams as well.
Would you want me to give you a brief demonstration of the platform or do you want me to look into yours, how you've set it up?
And if we could play around with that, how would you like me to go ahead from here?
I think a demonstration would be great.
Perfect.
Sounds great.
Let me then just share my screen and we can get started.
I hope you guys can see my screen now.
Yeah, yeah, perfect.
Great.
Let me know if you have any questions in between while I take you through this.
So feel free to interrupt me in between as well.
Just a quick introduction.
Team.
Hiver is a tool that sits right on top of your Gmail and helps you managing the shared email addresses which are shared across different individuals.
Now, here, as you can see, I'm logged into my Gmail, which is Yukta at the rate.
And I have hiver Chrome extension downloaded.
And these are the shared mailboxes that I'm part of today, like how you have created it for, hello at the rate.
Likewise in my company, I have these different shared mailboxes that I'm part of.
I take an example of support.
Is there a question?
No, no, okay.
Okay.
No problem.
So, I'll take an example of support inbox here.
But before that, one thing that you would have to keep in mind is your primary inbox will remain as it is, right?
So all the emails that are flowing to your personal inbox, they will have nothing to do with hiver, hiver's, functionalities will be restricted to the shared mailbox that you will create with it.
So as you can see, this is my support inbox that I'm part of today.
All my team members are here as well.

Now, the workflow will look something like this wherein you would be able to see all the emails in one place, under unassigned section, whoever is writing to hello at the rate, this is where you will be able to see all these brand new emails.
And from here, if I click on the first one on the right side, you can see this is my activity panel from where I can do a couple of things, right?
Number one is I can assign this email to the right person.
So among three of us, whoever needs to work on this email, we can give that ownership to that person so that there is no confusion between us at all times.
That who is handling what?
Once I assign this to myself, this goes into the mind section and this is where I'll have all the emails that are assigned to me.

Now, for Talha, you know, specifically, although the team section is accessible to all individuals but for a supervisor or a manager or even as a teammate, this section becomes very important because this is where you will be able to see the open emails for everyone across the team.
So that if let's say, Jeevan has three open emails currently, and I need to collaborate here, probably.
Get it assigned to myself.
I can do that or if somebody is not in office, let's say matt has three emails here and he's out of office, he's not going to be there for next two days.
And we don't want these emails to be sitting here and waiting for his comeback.
I would rather go ahead and select these all and I just reassign those to myself so that I can take these up while he's not present.
So this becomes very easy to sort of be able to manage the workflow.
Understand how the total distribution looks like between the team who is handling what and where are we in terms of the progress as well?
Just taking a quick pause here in case if you have any questions.
All good.
No, no questions here.
All good.
Yeah, thank you.
Perfect.
Great.
So, in terms of the assignment, I just showed you the manual way of assigning these emails to yourselves, but you can automate this process too.
In case all three of you are working on random emails.
There is no specific rule that this email has to go to, you know, Katie or somebody else.
In that case, you can also enable the round Robin assignment rule which will let you to auto assign these emails between yourselves.

We can exclude Talha, since he's not going to be working on these and these emails then will go, you know, first come first basis between all three of you so that you don't have to assign them yourself.
So this is something you could use.
Do you think this could be useful or manual way of assignment also works at this point?
I think both could be useful to be honest.
Yeah, of course, the manual way is always going to be there.
This is just to, you know, from the scalability perspective, this is something that could be used as well.
And of course, on top of it, you can set up certain automations as well based on the workflow.

So if you have certain, you know, items that are only taken care by let's say one person, we can automate such workflows as well based on different conditions in the subject or a keyword putting there, we can auto assign those emails as well or trigger different actions that we would like to, right?
So we can do different things in terms of the workflows as well.
Any question on this?
No, okay.
Perfect.
I think apart from the automations and assignment, you would have tags as well to categorize your emails into different categories.
So this will then become your online repository under tags wherein you can fetch the, you know, all the emails related to one topic.
So you can create tags as per your workflow.
And this will allow you to not dig through all the emails to find the right ones.
You can actually club all emails related to one topic, so that it becomes very easy for all of you to access these.
Rather, you know, quickly.
So this is something you could do.
And then of course, as you're working on any email, you can use email templates here.
So the templates are something that you can create for everybody's usage.
And as you're working on repetitive sort of emails that are coming in instead of typing out the whole response, you can just insert those templates by putting the keywords and it's good to go.
If you want to modify it further, you can do that as well.
If you want to collaborate with your colleague, you can do it right here by adding a note mentioning them so that you both can converse while you save this as a draft.
So that if I mentioned Kathy here, then Kathy will give a notification and we both can converse in regards to this ongoing email so that we don't have to forward it or mark each other in CC.
Okay.
Yeah.
So this would be for your internal collaboration.
And then lastly, of course, the starters will help you sort of marking the starters as per the progress that you have made on any email.
So all the emails in the mind section are currently open.
So only when you go ahead, reply to this email.
And if you think this is done, you come here and mark it as closed so that it no longer sits in this section and goes into the closed one where you can access all your closed emails in one place.
And if there are any replies on either closed ones or pending emails, they'll populate back into your mind section so that you don't miss them.
Okay.
Am I right in thinking the tags are like shared labels?
Yeah, you could say that, yes, they are.
They're replacing your labels?
Okay.
So they do have an existing workflow with labels.
So we could replace that with the tags?
Yeah, absolutely.
Okay.
Anything else that you would be interested in?
This is the basic workflow that I've just showed you.

I've not touched based upon the AI functionalities yet because through tags, if you are using labels and if you replace them with tags, you can actually use AI tagging, wherein if you apply the same tag to the similar kind of emails, so AI sort of learns that behavior and helps you applying those tags for you.
And then you have AI copilot as well wherein you can get a help in drafting your responses in the ask AI.
You can put your company details on which the AI can train itself on and help you with any questions while you're working on any email.
So these are AI capabilities that you could potentially use as well.
Okay.
So we have had a few issues with onboarding.
So everything is working as you've described here in the Gmail in Chrome on the desktop.
Yeah.
But we've also got ipads in use.
Okay?
And we've been unable to use the Chrome extension in the iPad and we have downloaded the hiver in Gmail app as well.
But that seems to only have a mobile view.
Yeah.
The mobile, where have you downloaded the app in the iPad?
On the iPad?
Yeah.
Yeah.
So on iPad, it won't work.
The mobile application is only for mobile at this point.
So hiver for Gmail will only work on mobile.
Did you try through Google Chrome in iPad?
Yeah.
It's not possible to use extensions on there.
Yeah.
Then it might not work on iPad as well.
So currently, then it only supports the desktop version, which is your browser on your computer and mobile.
Okay.
Yeah.
Is that something which is like an important part for you to be able to use it on iPad?
Yeah.
We do use ipads, So yeah, we're able to use the app in like a mobile view.
Yeah, it's not very usable on the iPad.
Yeah.
I can understand that may create a friction there.
No worries.
I can check for the iPad thing whether the browser is supported or not.
But if you're saying that it's not working then… it might not, but I can check this with the product team and then confirm it as well over the email.
Yeah, or if you can find out if there's any plans to improve the iOS app, to add iPad support?
Yeah.
I'll check that although we wouldn't have such plans in the near future, but I can check it because this is the first time that I'm also hearing the iPad usage.
Mostly companies don't use an iPad, but yeah, I can definitely check and then at least pass the feedback so that we can take that into account and build that feature.
Okay.
Yep.
Cool.
Anything else that you would want me to take you through?
Did you get a chance to look at the pricing?
Do you want me to give you the view on the pricing, how that works?
Yeah.

So in terms of the pricing, these are the different plans that we have.
Did you get a chance to look into these, understand which plan will suffice your needs at this point?

Yeah.

And then you could look at either the growth plan.
I think this should work well as it will give you the templates, the tags that you're looking for.
So my recommendation would be to go ahead with the growth plan.
And if you have more functionalities… or a need, then probably you can look at the pro.
Okay.
And what's the key differences here?
Between the growth and the pro plan?
Yeah.

So the difference is basically on the functionality part of it, you get more functionalities here in terms of better analytics, business hours, number of shared mailboxes also increase in this plan, number of automations, are, you know, will increase too.
So based on the functionalities that you require, I think, you know, you can make a decision between these two plans.
Okay.
Are there any key differences that are important for most customers?
Not really.

Limit is here.
Okay, you can exclude people.

Okay.
Before they're unavailable?
Exactly.
So that.
It is.

And then of course, you have unlimited tags that you can create templates and all of these things as well.
